{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35127].
  {panel}

Please don't resolve as duplicate.
----

This is _again_ a try to get a specific answer from Atlassian for the compromise I proposed in CONF-28275 and CONF-34676.

# We are using Confluence to share content with customers and partners
# We branded each Space with the company logo of each company
# We migrated to Confluence 5 - and all logos are now defaced and therefore violating the corporate [CI|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_identity] / [CD|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_design] rules of all connected companies
# We don't expect Atlassian to return to the previous behavior - they could there rounded logo approach according to _their_ CI/CD rules
# We appreciate the initiative of John Mason for CONF-35037
# But *we can not wait* until this change is done, assuming that this will take at least 6 month

*Suggestion: restore logo behavior for the Documentation Theme only*
# Don't change the new Confluence 5 default theme because there are limitations in case of the size of logos e.g. in the navigation bar on the left
# But this limitation _does not apply_ to the "Documentation Theme", there is still plenty of space on top of each page, as in Confluence 4
# Therefore, please restore the behavior of Documentation Theme and remove the enforcement of rounded logos for this specific Theme only until CONF-35037 is done

We would take a pass on using the new Theme an we would migrate the entire content to the Documentation Theme.

Probably it's just a simple CSS modification to re-enable the logo behavior for the Documentation Theme ?
fields.summary: Restore Space Logo behaviour for Documentation Theme until CONF-35037 is done

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35120].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
When you access Confluence after already accessing some spaces, it'll show the list of recent spaces as in this screenshot (not the title _Recent spaces_):
!Recent_spaces.png!

However, if it's the first time you're accessing Confluence, the menu doesn't show any spaces (as expect), but the title is also removed causing the impression that you don't have access to any space:
!Black_list_of_spaces.png!

This is specially confusion if you have defined a Space as your [Site Home Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Site+Home+Page]

h4. Suggestion
We should keep the tile _Recent spaces_ even if it's the first time an user access the application to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Improve Space menu on the top header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35119].
  {panel}

In the latest version of Confluence, when we search for a user in the quick search field, we will provided with the user full name with its profile picture (if there are any).

Most users that click it think it will direct them to their personal space if the user have it, if the user doesn't have it, it will redirect them to the user profile page.

Regardless, Confluence will direct the user to the user in questioned profile page instead of their personal space.

This behaviour is fine if personal space (home page of the space) is searchable in the quick search which is not and the only way for user to search the personal space is by using the full page search menu.

*Possible Workaround*

# Provide both profile and personal space in quick search, with caption so users can differentiate which link will direct them to profile page and vice versa.
# Combine personal space home page with user profile page as describe on this [request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31968]
fields.summary: Personal Space is not searchable using quick search feature

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35092].
  {panel}

As of Confluence 5.5, Confluence is creating a *recovery* folder in the {{<home>}} directory during the upgrade procedure and this folder contains following two files:

# upgradeRecoveryFile-xxxx-xxxx-before.xml
# upgradeRecoveryFile-xxxx-xxxx-after.xml

Unfortunately, these two files are do not function as an XML backup does and it can cause confusion for customers, who think that Confluence is generating an XML Backup before performing the upgrade procedure. It'd be great to rename this folder and mentioned files to avoid confusion.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35077].
  {panel}

h3. Step to reproduce:
# Create a table with 30 row.
# Fill all the table row with some word
#  Highlight one of the row  and click the JIRA issue icon
# Select the option {{Create X issues from this table}} 
# Then select create.

+Expected result+
New JIRA issue will be created in JIRA project and the link will be added in the Confluence page.

+Observed result+
New JIRA issues are created in JIRA project however no link are added in the Confleunce page. Sometimes the process will hang and you are force to refresh the page. An error is displayed: {quote}X issues have been created, but there are problems in adding them to the page.
You can manually add them later using JIRA macro.{quote}

*(Jul-19-2018)* - A recently observed result in Cloud application: Instead of displaying the message above, it only refreshes the page and the content is not created in Confluence. Only in Jira. 



The following will appear in the logs as well:
{code}
2014-09-17 13:16:09,661 WARN [http-bio-8091-exec-1] [internal.integration.jira.DefaultJiraService] communicateWithJira Problem communicating with JIRA
 -- referer: http://new.com/display/WEB/test | url: /teamsite/rest/jira-integration/1.0/issues | userName: van.ly
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.executeAndReturn(HttpClientRequest.java:376)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.executeAndReturn(JerseyRequest.java:161)
{code}


*(May-29-2019)* - The JIRA Issue link is added when using the old editor. This seems to be affecting only the new Confluence editor.

h3.Workaround
The only available workaround is to manually add JIRA issue links to the page.  

OR

Use the old editor

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35040].
  {panel}

*Related*
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24883 (similar issue)
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34870 (slow page move increases window of deadlock)

*Suggested fix(es)*
* Have single (cluster wide) queue for page move operation
* Hold (cluster) composite lock (parentID:childId), or do two locks in natural ordering (parentId -< childId).

*Side effect of this bug*
* Page Tree cycling eternally and causes OOM in under few minutes.
* breadcrumbs hits stackoverflow
* other plugins (indexing?) are not guaranteed to handle cyclic graphs in confluence.

*Symptoms*:
nginx:
{noformat}

172.24.12.144 - - [23/Sep/2014:01:41:04 +0000] "GET /pages/movepage.action?pageId=2301533426&position=below&targetId=2302876189&atl_token=1a8fab263d4644b9373a3453c9bceea99fdd9166&_=1411436461303 HTTP/1.0" 200 297 "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ST" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:32.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/32.0"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35037].
  {panel}

Complete themes can be created and applied to an individual Confluence space, but it requires a moderate to large amount of time and technical knowledge to do so. Confluence would benefit from a way to quickly and easily "brand" a space visually.

h5. Work in progress
I've attached a mockup showing some early thinking we've done. This is _not_ final, but does show you one of our current ideas about how this could work.

You'd be able to:
* Apply a banner across the top of the Space Homepage
* Have it shown in a stylised view at the top of the sidebar
* Have the option to turn the Space avatar off completely in the sidebar

As you can see, this gives plenty of room to put much richer branding across the space.

h5. Feedback
We'd love to get general feedback on how useful this would be overall and to answer some specific questions:
* Would you like to see the banner on all pages in the space, or just the home page?
* Is the opaque stylised treatment applied to the banner acceptable to those with branding guidelines to meet?
* Would you want to keep the space name or have it turn off along with the space logo?
fields.summary: Ability to quickly brand a space

After upgrading confluence from 4.3.7 to 5.5.3, I saw one difference. Previously in 4.3.7 on clicking of the Users link, it used to opens up the users search screen without doing any search. It navigates to the URL confluence/admin/users/browseusers.action in the browser. 
But now in 5.5.3, on clicking of the Users link, it is opening up the user search after searching all the users. It is navigating to the URL confluence/admin/users/showallusers.action in the browser.
I do not want the search to happen on click of Users because it is taking long time to open up the user search page.
To change this behavior I tried to modify the viewuser.vm file present inside /confluence/admin/users directory. I changed href="browseusers.action" from href="showallusers.action" but the URL did not get change and the search is happening after the change also.
It will be really helpful if anybody can provide pointers for the places where I need to change to modify the URL so that the automatic search will not happen.

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
Copy-paste into Confluence page on Linux + Firefox 32

Copy-paste into Confluence page on Windows 7 + Internet Explorer 11
Then: Adjoining lines are fused, forming single paragraphs in Confluence. Very nice! This is what we want.

Copy-paste into Confluence page on Windows 7 + Firefox 32
Then: Every line forms a paragraph by itself.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35015].
  {panel}

Rendering errors with macros and pages need to be improved in several key ways:

#. page render timeouts show no page contents at all. On page render timeout, we should show any page content we managed to collect so far, with a banner above mentioning the timeout, and a banner below mentioning rendering was aborted at this point.
#. macro render timeouts show no contents of the macro body. On macro render timeout, we should show a banner where the macro should be saying the macro timed out, any macro body content we've rendered so far, and another banner indicating the macro rendering aborted at this point.
#. any other macro rendering failures show no contents of the macro body either. On macro errors (e.g. macro not found) we should render the macro body contents anyway. This will make it easier for users to view what content they might be missing when macros are broken, and avoid the need to rewrite pages when macros are temporarily disabled.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34998].
  {panel}

When creating a mirror image for testing purposes of our Jira instance, we then need to delete the application link to the Production instance of Confluence.
This then breaks the application link between our Production Jira and Production Confluences as well.
The only solution that has worked is to delete then re-add the application links on both sides (same URL as was there in the first place).
However:
Jira macros in Confluence display "Error rendering macro 'jira' : Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration".

Steps to fix:
1. Edit page
2. Edit macro
3. The macro still contains the issue number. Click the magnifying glass, re-find the correct issue.
4. Save page.

Since the macro is saving the issue number, and the Jira link is the same (just re-adding it), I shouldn't have to go through every Confluence page containing a Jira macro just to re-find information that's already populated in it. 
Ideal behavior is for the macro to take the existing search query it contains and search in the new application link for it, THEN issue an error if it can't find it.
fields.summary: Updating Application Link cause rendering problem: "Error rendering macro 'jira' : Unable to locate JIRA server for this macro. It may be due to Application Link configuration"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34994].
  {panel}

If try to import a xml backup from a Confluence A to a Confluence B with a user that exist in both instances your mentions macros will get broken due a non existing user_key.
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Set up Confluence and create a user (eg Jessie Jones: jjones)
 # Create a page under a dummy space
 -- Add a \{noformat} macro to the page - this step is required because the issue only occurs if there is CDATA elsewhere on the page.
 -- Mention jjones.
 # Generate an xml export of the space
 # Delete the space from the instance
 # Open entities.xml and find the userkey for jjones, and modify it so it is different to the userkey in the system. Make sure you modify every occurrance.
 # Import the space back into Confluence
 # You will see that the mentions will be broken:
 !broken_link.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround prior to import
 # Open the zip file and edit entities.xml
 # Find all occurrences of {{]] >}} (note the space)
 # Replace with {{]]]]><![CDATA[>}}
 # Import the space

h4. Workaround after import

For a full update of your instance, see [User mentions appear as Broken link after XML import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/User+mentions+appear+as+Broken+link+after+XML+import]

For update of individual entries, read on.
 # Shutdown Confluence B.
 # Run below query against *Confluence A* database:
{code:java}select * from user_mapping
where username = 'jjones';
{code}
(i) Above example is jjones but you will need to use the user name of the user that got the broken mention.
 # Copy the user_key.
 # Now run below query against *Confluence B*
{code:java}select * from user_mapping
where username = 'jjones';
{code}
(i) Above example is jjones but you will need to use the user name of the user that got the broken mention.
 # Copy the user key.
 # At this point we will have two user keys for user jjones, one from *Confluence A* and the other for *Confluence B*.
 # Now Run the following query against *Confluence B* database:
 (!) Backup *Confluence B* before doing the update query
{code:java}UPDATE BODYCONTENT 
SET BODY = CAST(replace (cast(BODY as nvarchar(max)), 'user key from step 3' , 'user key from step 5') as ntext)
where BODY like '%user key from step 3%';
{code}
(i) The above query was designed to MS SQL Server, if you are using other databases like Oracle/Postegres/MySQL as your DBA to adapt the query.
 # Start Confluence B, check for the broken macros again (it should be resolved).
 # If you notice any otehr problems or the macros did not got resolved then shutdown Confluence and rollback your database using the backup taken before the update procedure.

h4. Workaround after import if the original system is not accessible
NB: This workaround requires the original export file for reference.
# As an administrator, go to the page and click '...' and View Storage Format. 
# Grab the value of ri:userkey, eg {{ri:userkey="40288ac6444668f70144466ab1e70003"}}
# Open entities.xml from the export file
# Search for the userkey. You will find a ConfluenceUserImpl object that looks like this:
{code} <object class="ConfluenceUserImpl" package="com.atlassian.confluence.user">
<id name="key"><![CDATA[8a81818556b603360156b603fad80002]]></id>
<property name="name"><![CDATA[admin]]></property>
<property name="lowerName"><![CDATA[admin]]></property>
</object>{code}
# Inside the name property you will find the username, in this case it is 'admin': {{<property name="name"><![CDATA[admin]]></property>}}
# Edit the page and change the mention to that username

h4. Notes:

The reason why this happens it's because the mention macro uses the user_key to make the reference to the target user instead of the username.
{code:java}<ri:user ri:userkey="40288ac6444668f70144466ab1e70003"/>
{code}
During the import Confluence will not identify that jjones exist in both instances and that the source user_key needs to be updated with the target user_key.

This will only happen with Confluence instances on version 5.2.3 and latest since previous versions relies on the username instead of the user_key.
fields.summary: Mentions broken after space xml Import

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34993].
  {panel}

Editing pages in Confluence Cloud  using Internet Explorer 8 results in a black edit page.

*Steps to replicate*
# Open any page in Confluence Cloud while using Internet Explorer 8
# Click on the Edit Button
# Edit area will show up blank

*Workarounds*
Update Internet Explorer or access Confluence using a different browser such as Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.

Confluence no longer supports IE 8 since version 5.5, End of Life announcement can be found here:

[Deprecated Web Browsers for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+Confluence#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforConfluence-201310browsers]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34968].
  {panel}

When installing the JDBC jar file it must be installed in:
<Confluence installation>/lib

I had placed the driver in the originally indicated directory and continued to get the error: could not find driver with class name com.mysql.jdbc.driver

After referring to this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+MySQL+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat
it refers to:
Copy the JAR file into the lib folder of your Tomcat installation: <TOMCAT-INSTALLATION>/lib.

Applying this logic, I stopped the Confluence service, copyed the jar to <install>/lib, restarted confluence, no more error and I'm able to proceed with the install.

I am installing Confluence 5.5.6 from ZIP.
(5.6.1 install does not allow external database connection during setup)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34900].
  {panel}

Indexing queue impacts performance or crashes the instance

We developed an external application and a plugin to suit our business requirement. These two applications create or modify pages. These actions may product a lot of entries in the indexing queue, which can result in the following:

* Crash of an instance
* Slowing down an instance significantly.
* Stopping processing the indexing queue

*Migration Utility (External Application)*
The utility runs on the desktops of the users to convert and migrate content from a different content management dystem to Confluence wiki.

We are using the following SOAP calls in this migration utility:
* store page
* move page
* upload labels
* upload attachments

*Search/Replace Plugin*
This plugin helps you search and replace strings or macros within a space and replace them with new strings or macros.

We use DefaultPageManager to save new version of a page.

In both the cases, when the pages are added/updated/deleted in bulk (for example, more than 10K entries), the index is not clearing based on the flush interval. We are ending up restarting the server to clear the queue. In certain cases, it is crashing the Wiki.

Thanks,
Pavel
fields.summary: Indexing queue impacts performance or crashes the instance

$userAccessor.getUserByKey() function does not return the user information with the specified userkey provided.

h3. How to Reproduce:
# Login in as an administrator
# Go to _Confluence Admin_ > _Configurations_ > _User Macros_
# Select _Create a User Macro_
# Insert a _Macro Name_
# Insert a _Macro Title_
# Copy the following and paste into the _Template_:
{code}## @noparams

#set ($user = $userAccessor.getUserByName("admin"))
Hello, $user

#set ($user2 = $userAccessor.getUserByKey("2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003"))
Hello, $user2{code}
# Select _Save_
!user_macro.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result:
{code}Hello, com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl@694fb33a[admin,2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003] Hello, com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl@694fb33a[admin,2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003] {code}

h3. Actual Result:
{code}Hello, com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl@694fb33a[admin,2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003] Hello, $user2 {code}
!result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: $userAccessor.getUserByKey() will not return the user with the specified userkey

*Steps To Reproduce*
1. Log in to JIRA as any user. 
2. Create a JIRA issue. (Do not give User A the right to access this JIRA Issue.)
3. View the issue you created.
4. Click the Share button at the top-right and share this issue with User A.
5. Log in to Confluence as _User A_.
6. Open Notifications button at the top-right and try to send comment.

*Actual Result*
The message "Unknown error" appears.
Currently, it is difficult to understand the cause of this message for a user.

!improve.png| width = 500!

*Improvement Request:*
It'd be more user friendly if  a message similar to the following example appears instead of  the "Unknown error" .
Example: "You don't have enough right to send comment. Please contact your administrators"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-34892].
  {panel}

P2 add-ons used to be able to implement Confluence's SearchResultRenderer interface to display their content in a nicer way in search results.

For example, we at Gliffy used to utilize this hook so that diagrams in search results linked to preview images. Currently, since the hook is broken, the result link displays the JSON content of diagrams, which is obviously not useful to our users.

This functionality seems to be missing since Confluence 5.2. Here is a recent Atlassian answer which notes the removal: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/307952/create-a-search-result-renderer

Please put this functionality back in, or let us know what the new way to do this is. Thank you!

The current workaround is to click the gray Confluence page link below the search result description:

 !gliffy_diagram_search_result.png!
fields.summary: Confluence SearchResultRenderer missing since 5.2.3
